website_summaries.verdict: The quality of a Troy-Bilt tiller in a smaller corded electric version.
pros: Good for tilling compost into your raised beds
A lot of power for an electric tiller
cons: Works better going backwards than forwards
Not a full-sized model and not the best choice for very large spaces

website_summaries.verdict: A hard-working tool for a decent price. Not as powerful as some owners would like.
pros: Includes safety bar and cord lock
cons: Specs are not as powerful as the Earthwise

customer_reviews.title: So my favorite thing about it is how easy it is to ...
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised. When I first turned it on, I thought omg this thing is a weeny and then it prove me wrong. I didn't plan on using it where there's grass or weeds, just small garden beds but I was just testing it out. So my favorite thing about it is how easy it is to remove the trines to clean them. So far it more than meets my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Tigressbythetail

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Does not like to go forward, digs in and does not move, if I set it to minimum depth I works a wee bit better. I found If I set it down at the end of the row and drag it backwards its tills up the soil nicely. Odd way to have to use it. I checked the rotation of the tines and they are turning in the correct direction and the tines are installed correctly. My neighbor has a similar unit and has the same problem. Note, I am using it in very loose ideal garden soil that has been previously tilled.
customer_reviews.author: Ken J. Cayer

customer_reviews.title: Great little tiller.
customer_reviews.text: This items works very well even in clay. You do have to watch the cord, but it you put it over your shoulder it works great. We could not believe how well it worked in our heavy clay. We built a garage and needed the yard all around it tilled and we ended up doing a very large area. It worked better than we expected and now have grass and we saved so much money doing it ourselves. Plus we can use this for years to come. Added bonus it is so much quieter than those huge gas tillers and it takes half the time with no bad gas fumes!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Spring is here. I unboxed the tiller in great anticipation. It was a Troy so thought it would be quality. IT worked for about 5 minutes and just quit. Dead. Read the instructions , called he 800 number, but dead. Please do not waste your money on this like I did. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: LWK

customer_reviews.title: little power horse
customer_reviews.text: The Troy-Bilt TB154E cultivator exceeded my expectations. I ordered this mighty mite to prepare my front yard for seeding. The soil was hard and dry from a typical Virginia summer of high temperatures and very little rain. The tines of the machine bounced off the soil surface moving forward, but pulling backward helped the tines to dig in and really work the soil. After about 8 hours of tilling, raking and smoothing, I've prepared about 3,000 sq. feet, seeded and fertilized. A tough job made easier thanks to this Troy-Bilt. A great and inexpensive investment for any property owner.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good Electric Tiller
customer_reviews.text: This tiller does a good job for an electric one. It's very simple to use and clean up. After reading the reviews, I weedeated all the tall weeds and this little tiller had no problem. It digs much deeper by pulling backward. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mudmama

customer_reviews.title: Work horse
customer_reviews.text: I was apprehensive at first because it handled much differently than my last one which wore out in just a few short months. I have many more hours on this one and it's still going strong! I found that I have to "roll'" it for best results. Our soil is VERY HARD and I really give it a good work out! I use it 2 or 3 times a month. 4/13/13 I have continued to use this tiller all spring (several times a month) and it just keeps on ticking. I am very pleased and would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne O. Shippy

customer_reviews.title: it is beautiful. The first step roto till the dead grass ...
customer_reviews.text: I live in California and we are in major drought. I was tired of the dead front lawn. so I replace 3/4th s of it with a river of rock and created a meditation spot in the middle. it is beautiful. The first step roto till the dead grass out. This tiller was manageable for my strength and got the job done. I would recommend it and many friend have borrowed it to use also. Excellent excellent excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: This little machine performs exactly as advertised. I have added a number of large flower beds and this unit will dig where I can not dig by hand. I have also recovered an area of about 3000 sq feet of dead St Augustine sod (hard like rock) to prepare for new sod. I had a quote of 2K$ from a local landscaper to remove the old sod, put new top soil in and prepare for new sod. This tiller got rid of the old and eliminated the need for new topsoil. Saved me about 75% of the quoted cost to replace the dead sod.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L Selinger

customer_reviews.title: My husband is very pleased with his new toy
customer_reviews.text: My husband is very pleased with his new toy. Nice that he won't have to worry about mixing fuel for it, then emptying it for winter storage. Even better that he won't have to pay for the expensive batteries (he had requested one with batteries not realizing the cost). Since we have grow beds, the cord is not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Electric cultivator
customer_reviews.text: Have been using a gas powered rototiller that was always very difficult to start after sitting for a year in the shed. This eliminates the starting, winterizing the gas, spark plugs, and all those gas engine issues. It did a very good job of tilling the soil in our 20 by 30 foot garden. Will also be much easier to used for occasional tilling throughout the growing season. I would recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great little tiller
customer_reviews.text: My new house/property had room for a garden this spring, but the thought of hand tilling a 45 x 38 plot was challenging. Saw this Troy-Bilt electric tiller at a reasonable price. Easy to assemble and a breeze to use. Has the power to do the job. Light weight makes it very portable. One of the best features is the removable tines for clean up or to remove a problem pebble or vegetation clogging the blades. I'd recommend to anyone interested in gardening...
customer_reviews.author: Missouri Traveller

customer_reviews.title: Love my Troy Built
customer_reviews.text: I have used this every year to roto till my garden and for breaking ground. It works like a charm. However, I do have sandy soil, so I have no idea how it will work on heavy clay soils. The only thing I find hard is that I have to back up with it, but it certainly does a great job. I would definitely buy it again, should I need a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Rozee

customer_reviews.title: Mighty-might can do
customer_reviews.text: You really have to be patient and work with your tiller but it will do the job as discribed and nothing more. You want a whole yard?...get a larger rototiller that is built to do the job. This Tiller is a quality machine and love the non-gas approach to yard work. I also have gone from gas chainsaws to 2-3 types of electrical saws and they are great. At this time, after 3 uses, I really enjoy my Troy-bilt cultivator.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Dunning

customer_reviews.title: Our soil is fairly sandy and it did a perfect job busting through it
customer_reviews.text: Our soil is fairly sandy and it did a perfect job busting through it. We did have some tangling issues when we tried to till up an established flower bed, but it wasn't anything that wasn't easily fixed. Very pleased with how well this works for what we needed (12x12 garden.)
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Family

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This lighweight system does what it is supposed to do. I have been able to dig trenches along with till up the back yard to put in a sprinkler system. Truly reduces the back breaking work of tilling up the dirt with shovels and picks.
customer_reviews.author: michael perry

customer_reviews.title: Love this tiller!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once but I really liked it as it is not heavy and it is easy to handle for a lady! It did a great job in my raised bed veggie garden. Also it was not much to put together! I really appreciated that!
customer_reviews.author: Elvis's Girl

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it, easy to handle, not overly heavy to move. I recommend for any small farmer
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight tiller at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews of the Troy-bilt tiller before buying, and decided to purchase it based on all the positive comments. It lived up to our expectations--very lightweight and easy to use. Does a great job on our raised garden beds. Very pleased with its performance, and we thought the price was very reasonable compared to others we looked at in stores and online.
customer_reviews.author: Carol O.

customer_reviews.title: Five stars for half the price of a gas powered equivalent model
customer_reviews.text: I have a hard-pan soil that is known to break shovels, pick axes, and your back. This thing chewed it up like it was sand! I went over the area a couple times to make sure I got deep enough and got all the roots out. A gas powered tiller would perform better, I am sure. Gas would be faster, more powerful - more expensive, noisier, smellier, heavier, and more maintenance... if all that is what you are looking for - then stay away from this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: troy-bilt tb154e garden cultivator
customer_reviews.text: i purchased this little garden cultivator because of the ratings from amazon customers and the amazing reviews posted. i have a small space 20'x8' that i wanted my husband to fix for me to plant a few vegetables. we have a lot of roots and hard ground in the area that i wanted prepared. this little machine worked like magic. he had the area prepared in less than 20 minutes. then he decided to prepare the ground in a few spots for me to plant flowers. i would reccommend this troy-bilt garden cultivator to anyone that only needs a cultivator/tiller for a small space.
customer_reviews.author: Helen H.

customer_reviews.title: best purchase for the garden, ever ever ever
customer_reviews.text: works like a charm digging up small tree roots, grass roots (even that yucky nut grass that trails everywhere) and tough clumps of clay. mine's never snagged on rocks or overheated and I have quite a large garden. using this saved me quite literally days of work this last fall... very inexpensive for how well it works.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: We are thrilled to have this. It has made our lives so much easier when taking care of our numerous flower beds and raised vegetable beds. Able to achieve our goals in much less time. Long stringly invasives do get caught in the tines and you will have to cut them out, however, saves time and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Crime In Paris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. Speeds process and saves many hours of manual labor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Really Great for Small Jobs.
customer_reviews.text: I have pushed this tiller to its limits and it keeps on working fine. I have abused the heck out of this thing and it still works great. It keeps working even in pouring down rain and I don’t get electrocuted.
customer_reviews.author: BART

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a keeper!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! It had more than enough power to get through our clay soil.
customer_reviews.author: tiger01

customer_reviews.title: Wow, unreal.  First electrical tool of this nature.
customer_reviews.text: As my title states -- Wow. I did my best to video how it performs with UNTILLED area. Had to juggle the cell phone a bit -- Sorry. But the video shows how it manages to cut into the ground. Highly impressed. Finished my area in about 2 hours. Took small 5 minute breaks every 20 minutes or so, to give it time to cool down and clear out the roots. This thing cut through roots that were probably an inch in diameter. I got it stuck a couple times.. You just clear out the obstruction.. Press the Overload button and continue. I have not needed to clean it yet. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Man this has the power
customer_reviews.text: I had just bought a house I need to do some yard work. You know break up flower beds for the wife put in a pond. Break a little garden. I used this it is very powerful I wrote the company and told them how I loved this. And the price was real good. Troy bilt make a good product I also have a riding mower of there. I had it 3 years no problem.
customer_reviews.author: michael beard

customer_reviews.title: great little machine
customer_reviews.text: Finally a tiller that I don't have to wait for my husband to find time to till my garden. I just love this troy bilt, I have been wanting one for years. I bought this on Amazon after checking out other sites even troy bilt. This was the cheapest. It's great. It is so light I started up the first time I took it out of the box. Very easy to put together, I did it myself. Have used it several times and starts right up and does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: virginia hollerbush

customer_reviews.title: Great Small Garden Tiller
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, powerful, tiller for small garden use. It does an excellent job of pulverizing tough soil and working in mulch. It is even capable of tough tilling jobs. I've used it to break new beds. I've used my neighbors for years, loving it. He moved, so now I have my own.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save your back!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product for cultivating small garden areas. We had a mechanical problem but it was resolved by the company. The electric one is easier to work with than the gas model.
customer_reviews.author: Gordonv

customer_reviews.title: Strong and durable
customer_reviews.text: Bought to enlarge and till an existing vegetable garden. Worked pretty well though light enough that with sme soil needs a strong grip as it can buck a bit. Had a bit of an issue having roots and weeds wrap themselves around the axis. Bit of a pain to extricate them from the wheels
customer_reviews.author: cityToCountry

customer_reviews.title: Lots of power
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I was looking for...true to the other raters, the cord can be a pain (till with a friend)...but this thing can really tear through a garden. We prepped by turning over the garden with a shovel. Not next year!!! This will easily till through the winter weed growth.
customer_reviews.author: Cside

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Used this tiller to prepare front lawn for desert landscaping. It's a little workhorse. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph L Gause

customer_reviews.title: Is what it is. No more and certainly no less.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to put some beds in and while it is not going to reclaim lawn, it will turn normal soils well. It really ought to be considered more for maintaining soils than breaking them. Small, light, powerful, no maintenance, handy...what's not to like?
customer_reviews.author: Lodestar

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tiller
customer_reviews.text: For a small tiller, I am impressed with the capabilities this has. I expect a lot out of tools and like to get work done quickly, so I was a bit concerned that this wouldn't meet my standards. It won't compete with a larger more powerful machine, but it is sufficient for my ~400sq ft. garden.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: No gas problems here
customer_reviews.text: Own two of these. One I gave to a relative afar using it a couple of seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: POWERFUL FOR IT’S SIZE
customer_reviews.text: I really have not but good things to say about this tiller. It is powerful and works will stones,hard soil is no problem for this tool.Toro tools I have purchased mowers, weed wackers, You can’t go wrong buying this tool.
customer_reviews.author: CHUCK ABDUL

customer_reviews.title: Works great, just remember to take your time
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product to use in my garden and flower bed. Works great, just remember to take your time. This is not a full size cultivator. I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little cultivator
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little cultivator. I can easily maneuver it around in my fenced in berry patch. It works great for getting after small weeds.
customer_reviews.author: Cae

customer_reviews.title: Beyond expectations
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cultivator to help with a project in the front yard. This machine is like a gofer on steroids. Though most of the surface is mainly decomposed granite, it keeps scratching away until breaking through. The tiller dug up a rock which locked up tines. A quick service to remove the rock and back into service within a minute. The electric motor is definitely a plus, easily started and stopped. I would recommend this Troy-Bilt cultivator / tiller.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Davis

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this small tiller to loosen up the soil (red clay) in my backyard so I could plant new grass seed. It did a reasonably good job, although it does bounce around a bit because of it's light weight. However, because of some back problems, I wasn't interested in buying anything heavier to use. It loosened up some pretty hard surface soil enough to give the grass seed a chance to take root. All and all, I am very pleased with my purchase and look forward to tackling other jobs with it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Great llittle garden tiller
customer_reviews.text: We have used this for our lawn grass replacement project as well as in the garden for 2 seasons. It is sturdy, does the job and we just love it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda B. Lindquist

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and works great
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm, no issues with overheating or not starting. Edging accessory worked with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME ELECTRIC TILLER
customer_reviews.text: This thing tore through my packed red clay back yard in no time. Did the whole 750 sq feet in about an hour. You will have to cross back over if packed enough but very solid. Great product. Perfect for smaller projects
customer_reviews.author: The Bears

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Short axil make it unstable on slopes, but it does the work.
customer_reviews.author: S. Glover

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I have turned over a lot of dirt with this root-tiller so far. It is convenient to use and works well with my soil which tends to be on the sandy side. The unit seems to be well designed. It is easy to clean roots out of the tines.
customer_reviews.author: J. Burrill

customer_reviews.title: Tough little Machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty reliable machine; made in U.S.A. I tilled up a 600 sq ft area with this sucker and had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: B. Seward

customer_reviews.title: Handling
customer_reviews.text: It is great for small jobs and clearing weeds. Easy to assemble, and handle.
customer_reviews.author: jim buccini

customer_reviews.title: Little Digger big results
customer_reviews.text: Incredable value from Amazon again. This fully assembled machine cut thru grass, dirt and small roots. Tilled a 4x22 ft area in under 30mins! Should easily keep established garden perfect.
customer_reviews.author: musicman330

customer_reviews.title: tiller
customer_reviews.text: love it already had a big one by troy bilt haven't used it yet but lent it to a friend and he said it works good i'm gonna use it this week so i can get my garden started
customer_reviews.author: killerdeb

customer_reviews.title: Great tiller for he price!
customer_reviews.text: Don't be scared its electric. It's a little workhorse. It can get away from you since its so lightweight, but that's the only drawback. I use it on a 20 x 50 foot garden and it's a little beast!
customer_reviews.author: Germinator

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the price
customer_reviews.text: This machine is a little badass. Excellent value for the price! I wish I bought one years ago. Maybe I wouldn't be putting off yard work! Easy to use, light and tough. I am a very happy buyer!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works really well and it will fit in our flower bed next to the house.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerR Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Only used it twice but think I will be pleased with this product for use in small garden space.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Exum

customer_reviews.title: We have one just like it so our expectation is it will be as ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a Christmas gift for our son-in-law. We have one just like it so our expectation is it will be as good as ours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: I was originally looking at a gas-driven unit, as I feared that an electric one wouldn't have to power to bust up the sod of our former "dog yard." But it's doing just fine. Granted, our soil isn't hard, but the grass and weeds are thick in spots and this churns right through them. Going about twice as fast as I'd hoped. Had it only two weeks so can't vouch for reliability. But it has the feel of solid, USA-made components -- assembled south of the border, of course.
customer_reviews.author: B. Borgerson

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Cultivator for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great unit. Enter through my garden soil like a hot knife through soft butter.
customer_reviews.author: Edinorlando

customer_reviews.title: Hard to control tiller
customer_reviews.text: I choose this one because of the price. I found out later that I could have made a better buy. It is a powerful machine for its size and works well as a cultivator but if you use it as a tiller it is hard to control and maneuver. The blades will bend if you hit hard objects in the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Said Ghaly

customer_reviews.title: Ok for very light duty
customer_reviews.text: Returned. If your 6 ft tall or more you will struggle with height of handle. Also for very light duty.
customer_reviews.author: HarleyRiderForLife

customer_reviews.title: EASY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use this machine. It works just as good as the gas powered Mantis except easier! No yanking your arm off trying to crank it. The tines come off really simply if they get tangled with centipede grass or some skinny roots. It goes pretty deep -- maybe 12 inches if you have softer ground. For clay: not as deep. Overall a great machine!!!! My neighbor is already borrowing it because she can't get her other thing cranked.
customer_reviews.author: GADD

customer_reviews.title: 'My' Troy-Bilt Cultivator
customer_reviews.text: Powerful yet lightweight cultivator ripped right through last years garden no problem. Takes up less room than a gas tiller and no worries about a gas engine sitting idle for long periods.
customer_reviews.author: papalolo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Handle
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Fall of 2012 for my Garden. Small area that I garden in. It does the truck and love it
customer_reviews.author: SherriBabee

customer_reviews.title: great for a backyard
customer_reviews.text: perfect for a backyard garden. used it a few times well already. hit a few stones and 1 or 2 bricks and its still going with all its blades in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: NAZ

customer_reviews.title: Troy Bilt Electric Garden Cultivator/Tiller
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love all of the Troy Bilt equipment we have purchased in the past as well as our new tiller. It is so easy to use anyone can use it. I would definitely recommend this tiller as well as any Troy Bilt product because you get what you pay for; excellency. This product is absolutely tops.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use ,am 94 years old,reason I bought the Electric,can work the soil in my garden,67 yrs old daughter can use n flowerbeds.Lewis Gould
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Gould

customer_reviews.title: Great price and light weight makes it easy to move ...
customer_reviews.text: Great price and light weight makes it easy to move around. I found it did the job that cultivators four times the priced did but were much more cumbersome do use.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Great little tiller
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't believe the power. Great little tiller, and no carburetor to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Harold Walters
customer_reviews.text: The product works well in small areas such as floor beds. However, it is a little to light and hard to handle in tilling new areas that contain grass.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Walters

customer_reviews.title: OK for a 10 x 40 plot
customer_reviews.text: Does the job - needs a lot of cleaning of roots etc initially in the tilled area - much easy to use after all the stray roots have gone. Tills well but only down to about 6 inches.
customer_reviews.author: M. East

customer_reviews.title: cultivator/tiller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad. He has bad knees but loves to garden. Took a little time but it is light weight an great for someone who dont need to be pulling or tugging on a big tiller
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: NOT A HEAVY DUTY MACHINE
customer_reviews.text: A GOOD LIGHT WEIGHT TILLER FOR SMALL AREAS AND/OR "EASY" SOIL. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND FOR LARGE AREAS OR HEAVY OR ROCKY SOIL. I SECURED A SAND BAG TO THE MACHINE FOR WEIGHT TO KEEP IT FROM "BOUNCING" WHEN IT HIT A ROOT. WORTH THE PRICE IF YOU ARE LIMITED STORAGE, AND ONLY HAVE A SMALL GARDEN.
customer_reviews.author: HD_RIDER

customer_reviews.title: Tough as nails!!
customer_reviews.text: I received this product in one day, and was up and running in just a few minutes. I have very hard soil, chock full of rocks and weeds. This tiller chewed through everything! I had my doubts at first, based on the size of the machine, but I was thoroughly impressed with the quality and toughness. I actually managed to get a fist sized rock wedged in between the machine and tines, which stopped the motor, but after cooling down and resetting, it worked like a dream. I also love how it's super quiet compared to gas machines. This did in an hour what would would have taken days with a shovel. I loved working with it.
customer_reviews.author: Diane T.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool  for the right job -- Tilling the soil.
customer_reviews.text: Don't ask this cultivator to do the job of a larger machine. It does a very good job for its size. If you have what I like to call soil and not dirt or clay you'll have no problem cultivating in your garden. It is well built and is made of high quality material. For its price it does the job in rapid order.
customer_reviews.author: lou

customer_reviews.title: MTD troybilt JUNK
customer_reviews.text: used 2 times, 3rd time went 6 feet it stopped working, tried everything called amazon, no help, called mtd, no help, told me to take it to a repair shop, spent more money, it would still be junk, I was about 1 week short of warranty, still looks new, do not purchase this tiller you will be sorry, as I am.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley C. Fairbanks

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: No more pulling and pulling and wrenching my back with the pull start tiller. This little guy is so easy to start it's awesome and light weight enough so I can used it in other gardens I couldn't get into with the big one.
customer_reviews.author: Ileana Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: In years past I used, and loved, my gas powered Troy-Bilt tiller. Now, with but a small garden plot, I bought this electric model. It performs Great. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: tosim

customer_reviews.title: Great little tiller!!
customer_reviews.text: I just love this little thing. I used it to break up a new little garden this year and it did great. My son asked to borrow it and he liked it too.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Great machine----Bought it to replace a very old gas mantis
customer_reviews.text: Great machine----Bought it to replace a very old gas mantis. Use it to fluff up a 15x100 sand beach when weeds appear. Does a great job jn no time at all. The outer two tines can be removed, so it will work better than a hoe in our garden areas also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer  James really liked this book

customer_reviews.title: First electric tiller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to replace the piece of crap gas tiller I bought last year with the plugged up carbs. No more pull-start equipment when electric or battery power does just as good. This little tiller has plenty of power. When you hit it rock it just bounces off, and goes right back to digging.
customer_reviews.author: Gizmo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This little machine far exceeded my expectations! It tilled through hard unbroken ground with no problem! I wasn't expecting that! Very maneuverable and portable!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff hall

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This electric tiller replaced a motorized one that finally gave up the ghost. This works just as well as the old tiller. Good for a small garden but if you want a tiller for heavy duty work, look elsewhere. This unit will serve me well.
customer_reviews.author: James Anderson

customer_reviews.title: why I like the troy-Bilt RB154E Tiller
customer_reviews.text: I have a large troy-Bilt Tiler, but I hurt my left shoulder,therefore I could not handle it .so I bought the small one so I could use it with one hand.For the size and the price it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Poochie

customer_reviews.title: great tiller!
customer_reviews.text: My husband laughed when i told him i had ordered an electric tiller. we've always in the past had a big gas one. i wanted one for myself that i could use with no help. this one was great. i easily assembled it and put it to work. i tilled a small garden and also use it for flower beds. works great. i would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: cherylinkansas

customer_reviews.title: Great surprise/experience
customer_reviews.text: Was hesitant to purchase this small electric tiller...however its performance quickly disproved these thoughts. Highly recommended this tool for small to medium garden tilling tasks.AAAA+ perfromace.
customer_reviews.author: Rocket3

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is so easy to use, wish I had ordered at long ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cultivates good. but wheels are a bit cheap. Larger and wider wheels would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I don't have to break my back any more
customer_reviews.author: Konstantina Tsoukas

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be sturdy yet relatively light weight so I should be able ...
customer_reviews.text: I have not used this tiller yet but I'm very impressed with it's appearance. It seems to be sturdy yet relatively light weight so I should be able to handle it in the garden easily. I have had a Troy-Bilt gasoline powered rototiller for about 12 years and it's great but I have downsized my garden area and I believe this new tiller will be better suited for my current needs.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Bradley

customer_reviews.title: troy-bilt cultivator/tiller
customer_reviews.text: a very good buy! easy to use,amazed at the quality,,tore through georgia clay like butter!! also had roots from bushes,,no problem!!
customer_reviews.author: Nora Rowe

customer_reviews.title: it cannot dig into my clay like soil. That would probably take a larger and ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very powerful, attractive, and lightweight. Cons: It does not roll on the wheels very well. Also, it cannot dig into my clay like soil. That would probably take a larger and heavier unit. Overall I really like the unit as it does it's job.
customer_reviews.author: D. Calhoun

customer_reviews.title: It is Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: This tiller does an excellent job tilling the ground. I love it and will continue to use the electric tiller. This is the first time ever using an electric tiller. It is an A+ for me.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this Tiller
customer_reviews.text: Had nothing but bad luck with this tiller. The first one I bought from Amazon did not work out of the box. Exchanged for a new one. The second one worked until the warranty expired (used it about 6 times) and then stopped working. Called every Troy-Bilt service center within 40 miles of my house. They all say they will not repair an electric tiller because they are basically unrepairable. The tiller worked great while it lasted, but I wouldn't waste your money on this product. Seems very unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: pkampp

customer_reviews.title: decent power for size,
customer_reviews.text: Has decent power for its size and given electric rather than gas. Only complaint would be unit a bit light so have to oush down a bit to dig down. Adding a feature like the plastic sand tank like on Ryobis to torque it down a bit would help. But, for the price, excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Nettles

customer_reviews.title: pleased
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and does the jobs I wanted it for. Like it....just have to be mindful of the extension cord af all times.
customer_reviews.author: Judy K

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly out of the box, plugged it in to make sure it worked and it ran just fine. When the weather cleared a few weeks later I took it out to start using it and it would not start. Never even got the chance to get it dirty. Contacted the 888 number for somewhere to get it repaired and was given 4 companies. Two said it would be 4-6 weeks before they could look at it, the third said they don't bother with electric equipment and the fourth said f- you and hung up. So needless to say I am VERY unhappy that my $200 dollars was wasted on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Sacks

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Only used it once so far but it performed to my expectations. Will write more after I have used it some more.
customer_reviews.author: Larry TUTAK

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Have used other small tillers and this one is heavier, easier to control and powerful. It cuts through roots with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: stephen hume

customer_reviews.title: Can't handle anything but loose dirt
customer_reviews.text: This unit quit after 1 hour of use. I was using it to dig up dirt and rocks about the size of my fist. It did OK for 1 hour then just quit, overload switch did not trip, it just quit. I returned it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: brian h

customer_reviews.title: Saves the back.
customer_reviews.text: We are delighted with this product. It takes care of turning over our small garden in the spring. We did not need a bigger model and the best part it is an electric model.
customer_reviews.author: marie

product_meta.title: Troy-Bilt TB154E 6 Amp Electric Garden Cultivator
product_meta.description: When you want all the power and performance, without fumes or the noise, the Troy-Bilt TB154E Electric Garden Cultivator is a great choice. The Troy-Bilt TB154E offers all the benefits of the standard push cultivator for soil preparation and bed maintenance with the ease of an electric motor. The TB154E is simple to start - just a push of a button - and lightweight for easy control in tight spaces, including flower beds and vegetable gardens. The 8-inch steel tines have a combination of tips that are designed to dig, tear, and turn soil for optimum results. The motor is designed to handle the dirty and dusty environment of a garden. The Electric Garden Cultivator is simple in design but reliable year after year, it will keep your soil prepped and your garden green. The Troy-Bilt TB154E is backed by a 2-year limited warranty.
feature_bullets: Efficiently cultivate terrain using this machine's rotating blades with the ease of an electric motor
Equipped with a powerful 6.5-amp electric motor and 6-9 inch adjustable tilling width
Efficiently complete your chores with 4 forward-rotating tines ideal for cultivating in gardens turning soil up to 5 inches deep
Advanced 3-way tines are designed to dig, tear, and turn soil
Lightweight and well-balanced ergonomic design for ease of use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars230 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
